I would give this response a grade of 95.

This response thoroughly explores the significance of faith in the life of a Christian, particularly in achieving peace with God. The writer provides a comprehensive biblical basis for their argument, citing relevant passages and building a strong case for the role of faith in salvation. The response also effectively explains the nature of faith as a personal trust in Jesus' sacrifice, rather than just intellectual assent.

The only area for improvement is that the response could benefit from more nuance and complexity in its treatment of the topic. While the writer provides a solid overview of the biblical teaching on faith and salvation, they do not delve particularly deeply into the implications of this doctrine for everyday Christian life or address potential counterarguments to their position.

Overall, however, this is an excellent response that effectively explores the significance of faith in the life of a Christian and demonstrates a strong understanding of biblical teachings.
